snippet: The Mexican government has failed to create the tracking system it needs to understand criminal trends and improve security, experts say.
abstract: Mexican government updates its drug war death toll, reporting that 47,515 people have been killed in drug-related violence since 2006 but critics dispute the data, saying the government's tracking system fails to detect criminal trends or improve security.
lead_paragraph: The Mexican government has failed to create the tracking system it needs to understand criminal trends and improve security, experts say.

headline.main: Mexico Updates Death Toll in Drug War to 47,515, but Critics Dispute the Data
